All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Agent
A concrete subtype of Player that represents a Chess-playing agent that makes move "intelligently" and fully-autonomously.
AgentInfo
An annotation used by subclasses of Agent to specify their custom display names.
Bishop
A concrete subtype of Piece that represents a Bishop ( ♗ / ♝ ).
Capture
A concrete object that represents a capture.
Castling
A subcategory of the regular move that represents a Castling, with a King being the subject piece of the main movement and a target Rook making a subsequent regular move.
Chessboard
A class that represents a chessboard in a Chess game and manages the Chess pieces that are associated with it.
ChessGame
A class that manages the lifecycle and state of a single Chess game.
ChessGame.States
An enumeration of possible states of the game, which can be conclusive or inconclusive.
Color
A binary color enumeration: White or Black.
Colored
An abstract entity that is to be inherited by any object that plays a color-dependent role in a Chess game, including but may not be limited to all concrete subtypes of Player, Piece, and Movable.
EnPassantCapture
A concrete object that represents an en passant capture, a special type of capture applied only to Pawn's.
FormatException
 
GameException
 
HumanPlayer
A concrete subtype of Player that represents a human player that makes move via a user interface.
IllegalMove
 
IllegalOperation
 
King
A concrete subtype of Piece that represents a King ( ♔ / ♚ ).
Knight
A concrete subtype of Piece that represents a Knight ( ♘ / ♞ ).
Minimax1
An implementation of the most basic N-depth Minimax Search autonomous Chess-playing agent with alpha-beta pruning.
Movable
An abstract, generic, and overarching representation of a Chess movement, defined by: The initial position of the piece. The final position of the piece. The initiator (White or Black) of the movement. Upon initializing any subclass instances of the class, the instance keeps its own copy of Position objects in an effort to preserve a non-referential description of the movement.
Movement
An abstract and generic internal representation of a movement.
Pawn
A concrete subtype of Piece that represents a Pawn ( ♙ / ♟ ).
Piece
An abstract and generic representation of a Chess piece, defined by: The Color (White or Black) to which the piece belongs. The position of the piece in the chessboard. All Chess pieces: have a globally-unique identifier. maintain its move count. In addition, this class also serves to dynamically instantiate specific types of Chess pieces and define the generic behaviors of all Chess pieces.
Player
An abstract class that represents a player in a Chess game.
PlayerMove
A raw, "type-less" representation of moves made by any player that is to be interpreted, validated, and executed by ChessGame, serving as an input packet bearing only minimal information necessary to describe a movement initiated by some player.
Position
A class that represents a position in the chessboard, defined by: a file letter, the horizontal position, represented by an integer index in the range [1, 8]; a rank number, the vertical position, an integer in the range [1, 8]. This class defines all operations associated with positions.
Queen
A concrete subtype of Piece that represents a Queen ( ♕ / ♛ ).
RegularMove
A concrete subtype of Movement that represents a regular move.
Rook
A concrete subtype of Piece that represents a Rook ( ♖ / ♜ ).
TextSymbols
A utility class consisting of definitions for all relevant text symbols.
Transformation
 
TwoSquareAdvance
A subcategory of the regular move that represents a Pawn's initial two-square advance.
